Fabiflu works by inhibiting the replication o f the virus. Before initiating treatment with Fabiflu 200, you should inform your doctor if you are pregnant, breastfeeding, suffering from liver or kidney problems or are on other medicines. Patients with COVID-19 disease should stay in isolation in a well-ventilated space to prevent the spread of the disease. It is advised to maintain a proper diet rich in whole grains, fresh vegetables and fruits, limit salt and sugar intake and follow COVID appropriate behaviour and stay hydrated. Interactions of Fabiflu 200 MG Interactions with other medicines - If you are taking a medicine called pyrazinamide to treat tuberculosis. - If you are taking an antidiabetic medicine called repaglinide. - If you are taking an antiviral medicine called famciclovir to treat herpes virus infection. - If you are taking sulindac, a medicine used to treat inflammation, pain and swelling. - Some medicines can affect the way Fabiflu tablet works, or this medicine itself can reduce the effectiveness of other medicines taken at the same time. - Tell your doctor about all the medicines, supplements, and herbals you are currently taking or might take to avoid any possible interaction. Storage and disposal of Fabiflu 200 MG - Store Fabiflu tablets in a cool and dry place, protected from direct sunlight, heat and moisture. - Keep it out of the reach of children and pets.
